text: <!channel>: I spoke to couple of our classmates after the Uber presentation and heard that the west coast jobs sound intense and scary.  My brother works for Uber as a Senior Data Scientist. Do let me know if any one is interested to know more about the west coast jobs. I am happy to help. It is definitely not so scary.
The interviews sounded way more technical than behavioral. And technical means coding (Python/SQL)...
Yep but you need not have colorful resumes and know all softwares. Python and SQL are fine :)
I've seen a couple of visual resumes for E. Musk and M. Mayer floating around linkedin for some time now
I found this article which I thought was interesting: <http://theundercoverrecruiter.com/visual-resumes-help-hype/>

attachments.title: Visual Resumes: Will They Help Or Are They Hype?
attachments.text: In the competition to win job interviews, some savvy job seekers are turning to visual resumes: infographic resumes, presumes, social resumes and more. Wil
attachments.fallback: Undercover Recruiter: Visual Resumes: Will They Help Or Are They Hype?

text: it does highlight some of my concerns: ie. recruiters look though hundreds of resumes and this forces them to adjust
this article seems to suggest that visual resumes are better for reaching out to non-recruiter contacts
interesting to note that they will probably not be friendly towards applicant tracking systems
anyway, it's just an opinion, so take it with a pinch of salt :slightly_smiling_face:
the thing I like about them is the column split
